students will be able to: students will be able to:
Identify and name key technologies present in smart cities.
Describe how smart cities use resources wisely, keep things clean, and use less energy to help the Earth.
Recognize and make basic two-dimensional shapes (e.g. Circles, squares) and three-dimensional shapes (e.g., cubes, spheres).
Recognize the Tinkercad interface and become familiar with its basic tools and functions.
Compare and contrast the vertices, edges, and faces of di erent three-dimensional shapes.
Recognize basic road safety rules and understand how they help keep us safe while traveling.
Identify forces and explore simple machines, like ramps, using measuring tools to understand dimensions.
Understand the basics of electricity and create simple circuits.
Recognize and understand the basics of algorithmic thinking by following simple step-by-step instructions to solve problems.
